messages.message:
Hi team! I wanted to get some insight on accessing input files in apps and projects. For some context, I'm trying to add some keys to the context variable in UDFs pertaining to the input file (e.g. file size, file name, file path, and any other metadata that may be useful). Right now, I have access to the Document / ibdoc object and my understanding is I could use the job id to access the input folder path through querying the database. However,
1. Is there a better way to access the _input_ path / file?
2. If not, is there a way to get the job ID from the ibdoc? From there, I'm expecting to make an rpc call to query the file path and read in the data there
cc @Anil @pauline.comising

``` I'm trying to add some keys to the context variable in UDFs```
where are you trying to do this? in the flow code, in the step where you are launching the UDF, the step context should have the input folder / step folder

job-id is not stored in the ibmsg

>  launching the UDF
Here (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/99f2bcb4695953d475e5720658940ff7fdb6b86c/shared-utils/py-utils/aihub-utils/src/py/instabase/build_utils/udf_utils/udf.py#L181-L183)'s where but I'm going to add a helper function to take in the document or ibdoc
